availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Willis L. Shannon (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Warren County and Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Hill Shannon in Butler County, Kentucky, on November 7, 1843. Father of James Shannon, John Shannon, Sarah Shannon, William Shannon, Thomas Shannon, Annie Shannon, Emma Shannon, and Frank Shannon. Farmer in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 60A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 809-10.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Seminary, p. 134A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Butler County Marriages, Film #000367208, p. 48.
"Willis L. Shannon (1822-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial #21894447, accessed August 10, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21894447.
